body:
@Maratyszcza I'm getting the following compilation error on Windows:
```
10:41:41          C:\Jenkins\workspace\caffe2-builds\py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-windows-build\caffe2\onnx\onnxifi_manager.cc(23): error C2664: 'int onnxifi_load(uint32_t,const wchar_t *,const char *,onnxifi_library *)': cannot convert argument 2 from 'const char *' to 'const wchar_t *' [C:\Jenkins\workspace\caffe2-builds\py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-windows-build\build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]
10:41:41          C:\Jenkins\workspace\caffe2-builds\py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-windows-build\caffe2\onnx\onnxifi_manager.cc(24): error C3536: 'ret': cannot be used before it is initialized [C:\Jenkins\workspace\caffe2-builds\py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-windows-build\build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]
```
which means I cannot use `std::string::c_str()` as it generates `const char*` instead of `const wchar*`. Is it necessary to use `wchar*` on windows?
body_html:

10:41:41          C:\Jenkins\workspace\caffe2-builds\py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-windows-build\caffe2\onnx\onnxifi_manager.cc(23): error C2664: 'int onnxifi_load(uint32_t,const wchar_t *,const char *,onnxifi_library *)': cannot convert argument 2 from 'const char *' to 'const wchar_t *' [C:\Jenkins\workspace\caffe2-builds\py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-windows-build\build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]
10:41:41          C:\Jenkins\workspace\caffe2-builds\py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-windows-build\caffe2\onnx\onnxifi_manager.cc(24): error C3536: 'ret': cannot be used before it is initialized [C:\Jenkins\workspace\caffe2-builds\py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-windows-build\build\caffe2\caffe2.vcxproj]

which means I cannot use std::string::c_str() as it generates const char* instead of const wchar*. Is it necessary to use wchar* on windows?

which means I cannot use std::string::c_str() as it generates const char* instead of const wchar*. Is it necessary to use wchar* on windows?
